Reviews.Title: “Don't always believe what you read.....”
Reviews.Author: Sara J
Reviews.Content: We came down to visit family, and my dad called ahead and made revervations. Read reviews online and I was unsure if we should stay here....boy was I wrong!!!!! The rooms Newly remodeled, new owners and staff VERY nice!!! Walt and Brent were AWESOME!!!~ would DEF. stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Super 8's throughout the United States and this is by far the nicest. Clean and comfortable with all the amenities. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful in every way. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. Mike K.

Reviews.Title: “No complains”
Reviews.Author: Adrian S
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, the facility was clean, very close to down town...overall a great experience, will definitely come back here whenever I need a place to stay en Phoenix!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kayla A
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with a group of students from Texas A&M. The experience was great. Rooms were recently renovated, within walking distance from the convention center and easily accessible to the lightrail. The thing that made this stay the most enjoyable however was the staff. Walt was very awesome. He made sure we knew where we were going and set up transportation for us. Very very helpful and made the trip run smoothly! I highly recommend staying at the Super 8 if you are planning to visit downtown Phoenix!!

Reviews.Title: “You should definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel T
Reviews.Content: Not only was this Super 8 very accommodating to our large group of college students but extremely helpful! Walter, the manager, was very knowledgeable of the surrounding area and he definitely pointed us in the right direction for food and fun. He was extremely responsive when we needed help with transportation to the airport. Ohh!! And the rooms were super clean and smelled fresh. Although we experienced long and tiring few days at the conference, we were able to relax and rejuvenate once we got back to our hotel rooms. Slept like a log! You can crank up the air in your room to make it like an igloo too. Above all, best customer experienced I've had at a motel! Great job Walter and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: Joe H
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a conference this March with 14 other Texas A&M University Architecture students and this Super 8 was our destination for R&R. Walt, the Super 8 owner, went above and beyond to help our group out in any way that he could. on top of the already immaculate facilities and great breakfast, We really felt that we were being taken care of. For instance, our group was interested in taking a tour of a local attraction which was located 45 minutes away from the hotel. Walt offered to go and get a bus and give us a ride out to the attraction at no charge. When he found out the bus was out of commission, he made a few phone calls to find us the next best thing and most cost effective means of travel. I highly recommend this Super 8 to anyone seeking a place to stay in downtown Phoenix. Final tip: have a complimentary waffle (or 2)for breakfast, they will blow your mind.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: MNMeg
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask for at this price?? The rooms were newly remodeled and clean. Short walk to downtown. Friendly staff. Free warm breakfast. My husband and I wanted to experience downtown Phoenix but were on a budget and couldn't spend/waste $250 a night (what other downtown hotels wanted) so for a ~third of the price we stayed here. Glad we did. The hotel manager, Walt, was awesome and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in A Rough (Place)”
Reviews.Author: retdeltee
Reviews.Content: At some point on Van Buren in Phoenix, things get a little dodgy. Right on the border is the Super 8. I stayed here for 2 nights and had two of the best nights sleep in a long time. The room was super clean, everything worked, it was just great. The price was right, too. I booked it on line and went by the reviews, but mostly the Mgr's responses to the bad reviews. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate”
Reviews.Author: peter_somerset_uk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights and found the overall experience adequate. Good price, good room, great location and adequate breakfast. We had one problem with the room, the fridge did not work. I thought the management could have done more by solving the problem other than offering us an alternative room. This would have been a bit inconveniant because we had already un packed all our stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: Brent L
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for total of 2 nights. The hotel is pretty much road touch. A place seemed a bit over noisy during weekend. The rooms were okay. Breakfast definitely need some improving. The parking lot was dated quite a bit. Staff was friendly enough. The internet kept on disconnecting for some reason, it may have been something with my pc but I had used it a few days earlier at some other hotel. Overall stay was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaNative50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while attending the All-Star Game/Home-run Derby, etc... This is an older hotel, however has recently been updated. Our room was spotless, had new carpet, tile, upgraded bath, flat screen tv. Rooms are smaller than some of the newer hotels, however it was large enough for a king bed, chair with foot rest, desk, and entertainement center/dresser. A little weather stripping around the door would maybe help a bit as it appeared a lot of light was coming in which means hot air could get in also! A free breakfast was included with waffles, yogurt, cereal, toast, fruit, juice, coffee. Dining area is small, but very clean and organized. The property has a swimming pool and there is a computer in the Lobby area for use. It is an easy walk to Chase Field, US Airway Center, the light rail, etc.... There is a great authentic Mexican restaurant/bakery about a block away - La Tolteca. Manager/owner, desk personel, & breakfast attendant were wonderful. Very friendly and knew the area in order to recommend things to do and places to eat. This is a simple, but clean motel. It was quiet and comfortable. We will definately stay here again when we come up for anything taking place in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: familyminato
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Super 8. We are a family of 4 and spent 1 night here. We were just passing through so didn't get a chance to see much of the city but we found this hotel very convenient. There was a small convenience store over the road which was handy. The rooms were quite newly updated and spacious and the bathroom was nicely renovated also. The kids enjoyed the pool area which was clean. We really enjoyed the breakfast which consisted of a waffle machine, cereal, fruit, pastries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Rude Manager”
Reviews.Author: mightykale
Reviews.Content: One star is far more than they deserve. The owner of the property spent an excessive amount of time barking out reminders of hotel policy, was rude to guests and his staff. The stay here felt more like being in prison with the warden constantly in your face. People in the group that stayed were locked out of the room by management, forced to pay made up fines. The owner ruined the entire experience. If this is how customers are treated, this place won't be around long.

Reviews.Title: “Trip for National Championship”
Reviews.Author: AUJohn2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan. 9 & 10 for the National Championship game--WAR EAGLE--had a great time close to airport--but not 2 close, close to downtown--we used Arizona Pedal cab-(bike carts) back and forth--lots of fun--ate at La Tolteca--walking distance (1 1/2 blocks) wonderful mexican food--all on advise of desk people, who were just great!!!! Katie (very pretty) and all the guys, on all three shifts helped with advise, directions, and wake up calls---Wonderful--they are all GREAT!!-- would stay there again--rooms-- not fancy-- big enough, clean, nice, quiet--would not want anything else-- and for the game it was completely full-- so could have been noisy--breakfast was nice and good also.

Reviews.Title: “In the Super 8 Downtown Phoenix, we found some delightful surprises!”
Reviews.Author: weedle11
Reviews.Content: When we were planning our trip to the Phoenix area, we were on a modest budget. Therefore, we made reservations at the Super 8 Downtown. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised at how close the Super 8 was to the downtown center and especially the Metro Light Rail System. Then, we were warmly welcomed by the staff and General Manager/Owner. When we went to our room, we expected to open the door to a modest motel room. To our surprise, we walked into what semed to be a 4 star-5 star room complete with the following: king bed, luxurious furnishings, refrigerator, microwave, flat-screen tv, and wi-fi internet. When we walked into the bathroom, we felt like we were in motel heaven, complete with: luxurious granite sink countertops and shower walls, a deep tub that was big enough to seat two (comfortably and romantically), hair dryer, iron and ironing board, coffee maker, and some very nice complimentary amenities. The complimentary breakfast, while average, provided everything we needed to start the day. After staying at supposedly "nicer" motels and hotels, the quality and price of the Super 8 Downtown Phoenix gave us more than our money's worth and made us feel GREAT! We have already recommended this property to family and friends over the higher-rated competitors just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff except manager, rebar protruding in parking lot”
Reviews.Author: CopperMiner
Reviews.Content: Our room was newly refurbished, no outlets, had to unplug TV to charge phone. Tiny basic breakfast room, yogurt was curdled. Close to Chase Field, reasonable price. Our front bumper was destroyed by protruding rebar in parking lot. Manager refused to help, was very crude. Other guests helped get car off of rebar, they witnessed the incident and were even more upset than I was over the damage and the way the manager treated me.

Reviews.Title: “Super place and people”
Reviews.Author: wificontent
Reviews.Content: A very nice surprise to find a clean, affordable and simple hotel..that has the kindest employees in downtown Phoenix......close to university, museums, etc. Found this place online, and stayed over a week at this location in Phoenix,and frankly the hotel was well maintained, and clearly in transition from old mode..to plans of new.....rennovations. The staff....Walt and Joe were helpful daily, well informed and knowledgeable of local restaurants, bus service, and great out of the way places to eat...Authentic, and straight forward staff.....Location was excellent to rail, bus, restaurants, theatre, and museums without the go home broke price tag. Breakfast was limited, basic..so hopefully this will change. However, I recommend the place, and certainly will return.......

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Motel - Great staff, clean room, excellent price, primo location”
Reviews.Author: mh2010_2
Reviews.Content: When you exit the freeway just past chase stadium you will find this friendly Super 8. Don't be dismayed by the miles of ghost motels some quite vintage that you see if you go too far. Just go back to the Super 8 pronto. It's a short walk to the center of town and the light rail and the airport near everything you need at a real price premium. swimming pool and laundry, fridges in room. free parking, ample, not fancy, breakfast but so friendly and helpful. We recommend this place for the budget conscious traveler

Reviews.Title: “Value at its BEST!”
Reviews.Author: hadfuninaz
Reviews.Content: Found this location 8 blocks for the convention center. After reading some of the reviews I was a little worried about booking here. From the moment we arrived until we left we relalized we found a diamond in the desert. Service was as good as it gets. Front desk helped with transportation to the far side of town for a big event making sure we got a fair price for 15 people. A great breakfast everyday. Tips on how the public transportation worked. Great housekeeping servcie. Price was $100 a night cheaper than the other hotels in the area. Wil tell everyone I know about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra $50 per night for a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trav4vac
Reviews.Content: Room was filthy. Feet turned black upon taking sandals off. There was a large 6 x 6 inch stain on the side of one of the mattresses that looked like blood. Front desk clerk was less than hospitable. Would never stay at a Super 8 anywhere ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: footloose50
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for the price. The room was nice enough. Breakfast was minimal, with stale donuts, but you can’t expect much for the price. Try the Mexican restaurant right next door to the hotel. Great food, good prices and nice owners.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Cable_Hogue
Reviews.Content: Overall a good value for money in the budget range. The rooms were clean and had good amenities for the money. There was a desk! table! and small fridge!!! I don't remember if there was a microwave, as I wasn't paying enough attention. Everything was clean and ready to go when I arrived. The only flaw in the room is that the shower head is really low, so be aware. As a previous reviewer mentioned, this is on a busy street, which has its ups and downs. It is possible to walk to downtown Phoenix, but you won't really want to in the summer. There is a pool here too, but I didn't want to use it while I was there on account of the weather. The management and staff here are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 quality”
Reviews.Author: dperales
Reviews.Content: We needed an moderately priced motel in downtown Phoenix within walking distance of USAirways Arena. This Super 8 filled the bill. We stayed 4 nights and the front desk staff was very helpful. It is located on a busy street, so we requested a room in the back. There is a bus stop right across the street which goes directly to downtown Phoenix. We walked to USAirways Arena and it took 25 minutes. It is 15 minutes to the Arizona Center. A Circle K convenience store is directly across the street and there is a wonderful Mexican restaurant right next door. We ate breakfast there every morning and the family that owns it is wonderful! It is a typical Super 8 motel and it had a continental breakfast. Our room was clean and the bathroom was large. We got what we paid for and it was a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected from previous reviews!”
Reviews.Author: wandererMB
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for the Super8 on Van Buren, I expected the worst, especially since we had booked a room for an entire week. However, the room was spotless and the [king size] bed was comfortable. The bed sheets were clean and replaced every day and the bathroom had apparently been retiled recently. There was a small fridge and a microwave as well as a coffee maker and an air dryer. Yes, the towels were a bit on the thin side but adequate. Service at the front desk was pleasant. Breakfast was limited to juice, coffee, some cold cereal, so-so Danish, and instant oatmeal, but was adequate and the wireless Internet access worked flawlessly. The motel is within a pleasant 15-minute walk to the Phoenix Convention Centre and certainly more reasonable than the hotels in the immediate vicinity. The neighbourhood becomes a bit seedy once one travels in the opposite direction to the Convention Centre. I saw nothing that would make me decide against staying here again. For the price (80-90$), it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Dont cut corners with this one (no frills at its worst)”
Reviews.Author: aussiepete141
Reviews.Content: one day is all we stayed at this hotel and we were glad it was only for one day , the rooms smelled bad, staff are helpful but dont have any manners, the pool looked like a green swamp and the television remotes didnt work upon arrival

Reviews.Title: “Average but slipping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were not that bothered about if I wanted a room or not. Metal bars on the rooms window, view of someones dusty back yard. There is good if overpriced Mexican Cafe next door and a Gas station opposite with a cop standing inside watching all the customers, moonlighting?. The room was largeish but could hear noise from next door, I asked the front desk for a rag for my vehicle instead of using their towels , after turning the TV volume down, he explained they didn't have any and seemed quite suprised they existed. The maid helped me out. No internet but you can reach somone elses from around the center of the carpark. Someone could make a lot of money if it was managed a lot better maybe it's a tax loss or something.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own towels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was not bad for being so close to downtown. A few, "undesirables," in the area, so be sure to lock your vehicle and secure your room. The problem came when I requested a couple of additional towels for my wife and I (they only give two very thin ones and we had to use them for two days) and during a conversation with the front desk I was told the following, "we don't have any towels, your checking out today anyway so why should we give you additional towels, and we can't just keep replacing the towels in the rooms." I was a little shocked and offerred to exchange the towels we had for clean ones and the desk advised, "I would have to close the office and go wash some and I'm not going to do that." Customer service was very poor and unhelpful. The 1-800 number for Super 8 corporate office also advised that each hotel has their own policies and they could not do anything. I would not recommend nor will I ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: VermontDancing_Bear
Reviews.Content: We selected this because it was near the airport and the price was good. The hotel itself was okay (although the walls are paper thin) The problem is the neighborhood. We felt safe in the room, but outside the room didn't feel safe at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Phoenix Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 965 East Van Buren, Phoenix, AZ 85006
